title: Abul Momen
text:
Abul Momen (born December 18, 1948) is a Bangladeshi journalist. He had been a resident editor of <a href="Prothom%20Alo">Prothom Alo</a> since 1998. He is currently the advisory editor of Dainik Suprabhat. He was awarded <a href="Ekushey%20Padak">Ekushey Padak</a> in 2017 by the <a href="Government%20of%20Bangladesh">Government of Bangladesh</a>.
Background and career.
Momen was born on December 18, 1948 in Chittagong district under <a href="Satkania%20Upazila">Satkania Upazila</a> at <a href="Keochia%20Union">Keochia Union</a>. He was the son of littérateur <a href="Abul%20Fazal%20%28writer%29">Abul Fazal</a>. He completed his master's from the <a href="University%20of%20Dhaka">University of Dhaka</a>. He worked in Chittagong Art College, <a href="The%20Daily%20Star%20%28Bangladesh%29">The Daily Star</a> and <a href="Bhorer%20Kagoj">The Daily Bhorer Kagoj</a>. He won <a href="Bangla%20Academy%20Literary%20Award">Bangla Academy Literary Award</a> in 2016 in the non-fiction category.
Personal life.
Momen is married to Shila Momen. Together they have one daughter and one son.
